result.execSummary:
The defendant Jasmine Pantoja was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jasmine Pantoja is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jasmine Pantoja was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Danielle Chojnacki.
Petitioner Darius Mcpherson appeared, pro se.  Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by  counsel and petitioner.  Court grants petition.  Filed, signed Order.

No appearance by Petitioner.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Danielle Chojnacki.  Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Petitioner failing to appear, Court orders petition denied with prejudice for want of prosecution.

Petitioner Darius Mcpherson appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Nicholas Cerwin.
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Court adjourned hearing for reasons stated on the record.  Case calendared for Return of property hearing on April 21,2016 at 1:30pm in Branch 22.  Return of property hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Original RETURN OF PROPERTY HEARING Transcript (12 pages) commencing OCTOBER 21, 2015 received and filed. kl
Return of property hearing at 01-26-2016 01:30 pm
MPD Inventory #15013341(DARIUS MCPHERSON).

Defendant Jasmine Pantoja in court. Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner.  Court denies petition with prejudice.
Return of property hearing at 10-21-2015 01:30 pm
MPD Inventory #15013341(DARIUS MCPHERSON).

Defendant Jasmine Pantoja not in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record the court makes a determination that defendant is found guilty of Count 4 of the information and Count 3 of the information is dismissed (which are numbered in the complaint as Counts 4 & 5).

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 5 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. Straight Time. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 1 month condition time with Huber. Court stayed commencement until September 25, 2015 by 5:00 p.m.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.

Filed:  
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Jasmine Pantoja in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Student Intern Patrick Murphy under the supervision of Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference however which to proceed with plea and sentencing instead. For reasons stated on the record court grants states motion to dismiss Count 4. 

As to Count 5;  Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Jasmine Pantoja in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  David John Behm for Nick Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time to obtain an offer and discuss with their client.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  aw
This assignment is only effective as of 8/3/2015.

Defendant Jasmine Pantoja in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Substitution filed.  Case assigned to Judge Witkowiak.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 8/10/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 22, in room 608 of the courthouse.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jasmine Pantoja in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Danielle Chojnacki for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jonathan Cay-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney and the charges in this criminal complaint.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Arraignment scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jasmine Pantoja in court with Attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Joy Hammond, appearing for Dennis Murphy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs Court their witnesses did not appear in court; to the best of their knowledge subpoenas were not issued for the witnesses.  State requests adjournment of today's scheduled preliminary hearing.

Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, or any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jasmine Pantoja in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
